website_summaries.verdict: A modern and stylish design that is more attractive than other desk hammocks.
pros: Comes with a headphone hanger as a separate piece, so you can attach it to your desk where it is convenient
Adjustable clamps make the hammock compatible with various styles of tables and desks
cons: Some users report having to readjust the ropes every few days because they slip loose

customer_reviews.title: How To Re-do the Knots for Extra Security
customer_reviews.text: This is an almost perfect product, except for one big mistake by the manufacturers: they got the knots wrong! If you use it the way it was delivered, the adjustments will slip easily and it will not securely hold the weight of your feet. Take a look at the diagram I attached to this review. It shows the way it was shipped and the proper way to retie the knots. It shouldn't take you more than 5 minutes, and the effects are night and day! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT, exactly what I needed to keep my feet elevated under my desk at work to help with my ankle swelling problem. Very comfortable and easy to install/adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Brh1221

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 👌
customer_reviews.text: For reference I'm 5'0. My feet don't even touch the ground. :') I got this because I could find any foot rests tall enough and this was even cheaper. I love that its adjustable so you can change the slack easily. Having something that swings is also great because I can get fidgety sometimes and having long it means I can move forward or backward and still keep my feet on it. I work on an a Cintiq (monitor your can draw on) that's on an adjustable arm so I change my position a lot. Because the hammock is the span of my desk I don't have to adjust it everytime I move. The clamps are very sturdy also.
customer_reviews.author: minac

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping feet elevated at work
customer_reviews.text: Great to stick under my desk at work to keep my feet elevated. The clips are great but it is really designed to only clip onto the sides of a desk...which I don’t have access to. So. I had to clip them onto the back of the desk which is ok...but not great because it orients the hammock strangely. The hammock itself is a durable heavy canvas that feels sturdy. The rope appears to be cotton...so I feel like it will fray and stretch over time and I will want to replace it with a more durable nylon rope when the time comes. The accessory hook is optional...which was a relief because I can’t use it at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: faciltigre

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd Bought This Long Ago!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited so long to get one of these. So much better than a foot rest on the floor: not in the way when vacuuming, far easier to adjust to the perfect level, easy to clean, my feet actually like it! This can easily be used on a desk with solid left/right sides, as long as the back is open. It'll take a bit to adjust the rope so the hammock hangs straight. As mentioned by Kevin in another review, make sure to fix the knots that hold the rope in place!
customer_reviews.author: Kazeneko

customer_reviews.title: Overall just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The rope slips and I have to readjust to keep it at the right height. Maybe I'm missing something, but there isn't a good way to keep it where I have it set to. It only slips when I put my feet in it though. I've tied the rope up at the carabiners, that helps, but I still have to adjust on occasion. Other than that, I actually really do like it. It is much better than having an ottoman or box under my desk and it does seem well made.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, bad design
customer_reviews.text: When I got my foot hammock, I was so excited and for the first week it was great. But then it started to drop on me, one side at a time. The adhesive grips on he clamps detached themselves, one grip at a time. Hopeful, I continued to use it until my feet dropped from under me four or five more times, twice on my dog, before it found its way to the trash. Very sad this didn't work the way I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: How have I never heard of this before
customer_reviews.text: I usually relax and put my feet up on my computer when at my desk. I have scuffed and dented many a machine. Now I have the perfect thing and I can't believe I did not find it sooner. Adjustable, works great, saves my PC from scuffs and dents, plus it is more comfortable. Could be made out of hardier materials (hey my feet dent pc cases) but is under 20 bucks so I'm willing to chance it.
customer_reviews.author: Washais

customer_reviews.title: not good for your feet - cause rashes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it will be great to use as I play games a lot on my pc. After a few weeks of using it, I started to notice itchiness on the top of the feet. I couldn't figure it out for a while. It turned out the fabric was causing the rashes. I stopped using this foot hammock for a few days and the rash went away. The return window was out of the window so I couldn't return it.
customer_reviews.author: It's me

customer_reviews.title: still here after a year
customer_reviews.text: The pads for the clamps came off after several months, the rope has cut itself on the hangers a couple times and needed a knot put in it but its still the same rope. It has eventually come loose and fallen of my desk a few times but the metal has not broken and it seems the only weak point it has is that the hangers eventually wear the rope down but that is easy to fix and not a big issue as long as the metal holds. If i remeber ill put a date of the day the metal breaks cause it is expected, just not soon at this point, metal fatigue happens eventually
customer_reviews.author: Marklar

customer_reviews.title: Best setup investment ever
customer_reviews.text: This is what I’ve been missing my entire life. This foot hammock appears to be quite strong and sturdy. If I ever have another desk away from home, I will buy a foot hammock for that as well
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arnold

customer_reviews.title: A lot better than I was expecting!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a whim to keep my feet and heels off my sub woofer, which was *killing* my feet. This little hammock was a pleasant surprise at only ~$20, and has been keeping me comfy while playing games/watching movies. I've got a corner table, so if anyone wants to know if it'll work with one, yes. Just gotta tighten the straps and find the right places for the hangers. The rope slips now and again and I've got to readjust it, but that's maybe once a week at max. Very infrequent. I've also got pretty heavy legs, if that's worth anything. Overall, great product. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JWGuzzino

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed. Its just not as comfortable as I had hoped it to be. I love it because its not sitting on the floor and helps me vacuum under my desk easily (which is why I got it). But I can't use the hammock for more than a few minutes before feeling pinched and uncomfortable. I will need to find another foot rest.
customer_reviews.author: Orch1ds

customer_reviews.title: Had this for just over a month and it broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for just over a month and it broke. I also constantly had to adjust it (like on a daily basis) because the strings keep sliding, getting loose, and twisting.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer Girl

customer_reviews.title: 37 weeks Pregnant and In LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I am 37 weeks pregnant, just started a new position in a cubicle. this is by far the best investment i have ever made. It was an easy install less than 2 minutes its up and working. I love the fact that i can easily install it with out making any holes in the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: using one right now...
customer_reviews.text: Who would of thunk it! These little hammocks are the best invention, and a life saver for you legs if sit long hours in front of a computer. Easy to put onto desk and just let the feet hang. I got two and my hubby uses the other on his desk. Have had them for a while now and just will not be without them now.
customer_reviews.author: Katt A Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for Short People
customer_reviews.text: As a call center sales rep, this is the best investment besides an upgraded mouse and keyboard. Due to my tall office chair, I was having some issues with my knee. However, this foot hammock helped alleviate that problem. The hammock itself isn't extremely comfortable so I usually have a small blanket over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: It works for the most part
customer_reviews.text: It's very comfy and works as intended. The only complaint I have is it does slip after a little bit of use. I had to make sure to tie the rope tight in hopes it won't move again. Other than that, It works great
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Good for a while
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this foot hammock is that the metal against the threaded rope that holds the hammock up wears down _very_ quickly. Even with not much weight on it, the rope will just tear after about 3-6 weeks of use. I've re-tied the rope four times now and I'm just going to throw it out and get something better (the knots I made did not break, the rope just tore at a different point). To help prevent this, the ropes shouldn't be able to rub against the ridged metal clamps. But sadly this isn't a very well thought out product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Can't fault the product itself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to provide a foot rest for my 10 year old son while he studied and worked at his desk.I thought this would be better than a huge foot lift taking up valuable restate under the desk. It worked well for a couple of weeks, but as any slip rope will do it started to sag more and more and i was constantly fixing the height. Again, I can't really fault the product because it's a hammock and did what it was supposed to do. It's just not ideally designed for the weight, constant movement and the weird angles that desks can have on their ends to support the hook system.
customer_reviews.author: j.james

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality rope snapped in less then a month of light usage
customer_reviews.text: It's a desk hammock consisting of 2 blocks of wood, the canvas hammock, 2 brackets and a rope. Given the limited number of parts, you would think that they would be of decent-ish quality, but you would be wrong. The rope is the weak point. Lots of stretch, tends to slip, and for me broke in less then a month of light usage. I would recommend being ready for it to snap and having some sort of replacement for the cord, or looking for another product if you want to avoid the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Azuolas

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly bad
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this a little over a month ago and have only been able to use it for about 2 weeks. The first week I loved it it was very comfortable easy to adjust 0 complaints. Second week and I’m ready to throw it out. The rope keeps coming through the hole in the wood (easy enough to fix I just pushed it through again and tied a larger knot) then it happens again on another side then another side, then it just happened again but it was the stitching on the fabric that came undone. I feel generous giving it 2 stars, it should really be a 1
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best foot rest for under Desk
customer_reviews.text: This product really makes huge difference when you work at a desk for majority of your day. It really is comfortable and my coworkers always interested in it. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Akshar

customer_reviews.title: Not a long term solution
customer_reviews.text: I've had this foot hammock for roughly 9 months. For the first couple months this product worked fairly well, held position for roughly a week at a time before needing a slight readjustment. However, after a couple months (sorry i don't have specifics), the rope started fraying, then eventually was cut right through at the hook(s). The first time it startled me, as i seesawed forward. Overall, I recommend the product for under $20 USD.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Happy Pregnant Feet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to give my ankles some elevation while pregnant. I was worried about the headphone holder being an issue as I don't have clearance on either side of my desk, but it ended up being a part that you could "choose" to use or leave off. It was super easy to assemble and affix to my desk. No tools are required.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGirlJen

customer_reviews.title: Clamp on mounts are excellent
customer_reviews.text: I already had a foot hammock but the previous mounts I had didn't have screw mounts. I can tell you that having clamped ends for this foot hammock is mandatory and a necessity for this foot hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Mervyn Osena

customer_reviews.title: durable, holds.
customer_reviews.text: have had it for a few months now. If you follow the instructions and double up the lines on each side it never moves and strings hold up. I can sit at my desk for much longer periods now.
customer_reviews.author: B12

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly with my ikea Linnmon desk. super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When I started working from home, I decided to upgrade from my foot rest to a foot hammock. This is a nice product. I like that it clamps to the table securely. My desk is in a corner so I haven't tried the headphone holder attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole7483

customer_reviews.title: Comfyyyy
customer_reviews.text: I have a corner desk where I shove myself into. And I wanted to fix my posture as my lower back was hurting. Now that I have installed it. It's great! I'm only 5 ft so to have something where my feet don't hang from the chair or sit so low that I strain my shoulders is great!
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like to put my feet up at work, and this is perfect. It's easy to install, easy to adjust and move around if needed, it's lightweight but durable, and it has caught the eye of some of my employees who also wanted one!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was going to be hokey, but turns out it is pretty comfortable, easy to assemble, and strong. I beat it up and use it quite a bit and it isn’t showing any wear.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have ever bought for myself to use at work. It was very easy to install and adjusting it is super easy too. I have been using it for several months now and the adjustments have not slipped and the durable canvas is holding up very nicely to me heels being parked on it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I gave them to the girls at work, the ones that it fits on their desks say it is so comfortable. Just look at your desk before you order to make sure the connections will work.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine A. O'neill

customer_reviews.title: Idea was good, not the product
customer_reviews.text: I put too much weight on it and broke the string multiple times. I could have gone to home depot and bought a better rope for it, but I decided to just stop using it instead. Headphone holder can still be useful though!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and he likes it. He said that it is sturdy, comfortable in most positions, and just as described. For a point of reference, my son is almost 6' and he can rest his feet under his desk with this hammock. This is a decent product for the price. It is well made and overall worth the money. He said the only thing negative is when it is at a certain angle, it makes his leg sore.
customer_reviews.author: kts90

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my desk
customer_reviews.text: So the rope it comes with is thinner than expected, so don't put a ton of weight on it. Otherwise it's great! Exactly what I needed when PC gaming for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rah

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without it?
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived without this in my desk at work! I will admit I had to make the string shorter than it was originally designed because it was too long but I love this! My co workers are jealous and want to steal it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Barr

customer_reviews.title: Rest easy on this!
customer_reviews.text: This is way cooler than I expected. It works pretty well so far. Everyone at work is jealous now. The material of the hammock is soft but durable. The rope does not slip which is good. Definitely worth the $20!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: I always forget that I have this installed and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I always forget that I have this installed and it's a relief to my knees when I remember. My only issue is that the wood used to connect the ropes to the fabric can rub your skin raw if you don't position your legs right. Also, the straps do tend to move if you put too much weight on these.
customer_reviews.author: Invigilium

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I won wife of the year with this gift. He LOVES it. He’s been using it non stop for almost four months and can’t believe how comfortable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri D.

customer_reviews.title: Takes a load off
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful and allows you to lounge back and put your feet up and relax while you're surfing the 'net. Easy to install but be aware of the fact that your desk can't be too thick or you won't be able to install the foot hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Great Adjustability
customer_reviews.text: We were able to set this up for my husband, he had 3 surgeries on his leg and can not let that leg touch the ground. After we got it set up, I help him into and out of it since he is lacking leg strength as he works on easing back into sitting at his desk. We were able to adjust the angle of foot hammock to set it up so he didn't have to move the desk to sit there with a straight leg. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pads that grip the top of the desk are a huge flaw in this product
customer_reviews.text: The pads on the top part of the hook that sits on the top of the desk are already coming off after only a couple weeks of use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for cublicle corner desk!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work on all desks as advertised, but I made it work for my corner desk. Just not quite as comfortable. Also wish the hammock was longer and a little wider, my legs and feet hit the wood on the side of the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Rope broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this product that lasted quite a while and was very sturdy. This new version broke within a few months of use. The rope snapped and I was unable to fix it so I could continue to use it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Plastic holding rope in place doesn't work, and isn't as comfortable as I imagined it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. I tied 2 little knots at the ends when I set up the height I wanted and so far it’s been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Adri hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the fact that the brackets are multi purpose so you have different mounting options. It works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazo Custome

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but design is not all the way there yet...
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my 11 year old son who is a gamer but he never used it and because the hammock is not big enough. Probably after some more prototypes they will really figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Terry

customer_reviews.title: It was great until...
customer_reviews.text: I was enjoying this product. I am short and my feet don't touch the ground. This helped keep my legs from getting achy. Unfortunately, less than a month and one of the ropes broke.
customer_reviews.author: CosplayMom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic foot rest
customer_reviews.text: Now that I’m working from home full time, it was time to upgrade from using a shoebox for a foot rest. This hammock is very simple to install, easy to adjust, and the additional headset rest saved me some desk space. The material quality is impressive, and I can see this product holding up for years. I’ve had it for a few weeks now and I couldn’t be more happy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Nadonley

customer_reviews.title: The Hammock does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Overall the hammock is working well. It was easy to setup. One thing to note: the screw that attaches the headphone holder is designed to be screwed in by hand, but I was not able to attach it without pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: The adhesive on the padding is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The padding on both my hooks have already detached due to cheap adhesive, I’ll have to put a towel or something under them now to prevent any damage to my desk
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Good hammock
customer_reviews.text: It lost 1 star because it stretches a lot so you constantly have to adjust it at first. Other than that it works great, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: j shea

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a day
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t stay connected to my desk and eventually broke completely after a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and easy install
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up today and am enjoying it! Takes a bit to find the height that is best but easy to do with the adjusters. Clamps do not damage desk.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Caine

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great under cubicle foot rest! I recently had knee surgery and this foot hammock is great! Easy to install and you don’t ave a bulky foot rest on the floor!
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: A place to rest my feet.
customer_reviews.text: Simply but well made and fits under my 6 foot long desk with the clamps on the left and right edges. Works well and I have no complaints. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I moved desks at work and my old desk had a pole you can use as a footrest. I was missing it when I moved and I must say that this hammock is sooooo comfortable! I had to adjust the string length since I'm short and I wanted my feet to be pretty much parallel with the floor. This really helps me not hunch my back over at work when I'm sitting and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Screw clamps make all the difference
customer_reviews.text: I have both versions of this desk hammock and I must admit I appreciate greatly the upgrade to the screw clamps. They make all the difference and I have way more options for setting up the hammock. I didn't think I'd need the headphone holder but I ended up trying it out and now I think it's pretty great, too.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It costs a bit more than other foot hammocks but it's much better quality. The mounts are solid and the hammock isn't cheap like the other hammock I bought at first. Instructions were spot on. In all, it's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: hung

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It said that the max table length should be 55" (1.4m), but my table is 65" and I still have plenty of slack.
customer_reviews.author: Dee-L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have the right desk
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought this! Unfortunately, the way my desk is wont let the clamps go on either side of my desk, so it’s not the most sturdy when both clamps are on the back of my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for a family member and he loved this product!
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Rope is kind of cheap, but works as advertised Only had it a week.
customer_reviews.author: James Lehenbauer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy! Easily latches to the tabletop. I have a table with one drawer as a leg, so I screwed it onto that and it is perfect. Obviously do not put your full weight and forcefully be aggressive with it. But so far it serves its purpose. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Le

customer_reviews.title: Headset holder adds a special touch
customer_reviews.text: My computer gamers are loving this. The headset holder is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: momofboys

customer_reviews.title: Look somewhere else for a foot hammock
customer_reviews.text: The product is not worth the money, it doesn't stay where you want it to and the mounting brackets screws isn't long enough to mount it to my desk. Anytime I put my feet on the hammock it instantly loosens and becomes unusable. I would look somewhere else for a foot hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Not comfy
customer_reviews.text: This hammock wasn’t great. Every time out my feet on it it would sink. Not comfy.. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Was shipped and delivered very quickly, despite the current situation which I appreciate. The actual item works great and is comfortable. I didn't end up using the headphones holder because I already have one but I like that it is included.
customer_reviews.author: Juli

customer_reviews.title: You should use the screws if you can
customer_reviews.text: Totally comfortable, but it wasn't really holding well to my table. Im not allowed to out screws in the table, since it's at the office, but at home id probably screw it in so it doesn't slip!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect comfort!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable with an easy setup. I was skeptical when I purchased the hammock because I have a desk with a pull out table but it attached easily. The only thing that could use a little that is the length adjusters, during setup they weren’t keeping it at my desired length but once I got it attached to the hook at the desired length it’s stayed. Over all 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.author: Stanzi135

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: So fun. I love having this at my desk- two of my coworkers got it too.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my wife. She sometimes spends hours gaming on her laptop. She's been very happy to use this during those gaming sessions. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: George A Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Lounging in style
customer_reviews.text: Great way to give my legs a break at the desk
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, I'm wondering how I lived without this for so long!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pregnancy!
customer_reviews.text: I was expiernecing some pregnancy related swelling. I bought this item on a whim and it is fantastic. I work at an oddly shaped desk. Install was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Simple and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up!! Material is sturdy and holds my feet up comfortable. Easy to adjust!
customer_reviews.author: Eliana a

customer_reviews.title: Lounging at my Desk like a BOSS
customer_reviews.text: My favorite part: I can lounge at my Desk alleviating my lower back & no one is the wiser!
customer_reviews.author: JessicaAmber

customer_reviews.title: Bad Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I installed it under the desk and after a few weeks of use the rubber on the metal holders that attach to the table start wearing down, and it's just a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glooks
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, its steady and its adjustable. Not sure why it is so expensive though, but I guess its worth it
customer_reviews.author: Teyega

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Footrest
customer_reviews.text: It was not necessary to read the instructions as it was very easy to set up. Mounting the footrest was intuitive. I began using it right away. It is mounted under my desk at work. Love, love, love it.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: Great! Had to cut rope to make high enough for my drafting chair but seems to be a good solution. The rocking is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Lacock

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It is not confortable unless you have one foot on top of the other. The edges cut into your skin usually.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: clamps are not that clampy
customer_reviews.text: the clamps tend to not hold the weight of my legs real well. The clamps starts to slip and become loose. Eventually it is clamping the desk at an angle. However, the hammock part is comfy. I would suggest them to create a better grip on the clamps.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Def needed this.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy, didn’t think I needed one but I def did. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Shifts around a lot, but I’ve only needed to adjust it twice so far. I’ve had it about a month and use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and made!
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as advertised. Bought it for my husband as he’s at his computer desk most of the day and he loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Fun and worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my coworker. It was easy to install and it is surprisingly sturdy. She adores it, and the others in our pod are considering getting their own.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what you pay for, cheap but functional. I do enjoy it hanging under my PC desk and it's actually quite comfy. The rope is pretty thin and flimsy, could be better. Still, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Seckin Engin

customer_reviews.title: The best thing I didn't know I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly as described and sturdier than I expected. Pretty great that it's very adjustable too, no matter how high you want it or how wide the space is.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C. Ocasio

customer_reviews.title: Very strong!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and a happy little addition to my desk!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup and helped reduce pain caused by sitting at my desk all day.
customer_reviews.author: Stephsmith1228

customer_reviews.title: Too bad
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well with my desk and now I can't even give this away.
customer_reviews.author: BriBri1989

customer_reviews.title: So comfy at work!
customer_reviews.text: Took only a minute to assemble. Super comfy at work. All my coworkers are jealous and are getting one now too! Sometimes a girl just needs to put her feet up....... all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is jealous!
customer_reviews.text: Now, everyone in the office wants one. My desk is modern and only a couple of inches think. I can adjust this multiple ways and it is out of sight when my feet are not in it. You need this, just trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Halley Sarcoxie

customer_reviews.title: not practical solution for foot rest
customer_reviews.text: i believe that old school foot rest is the best so far as long as nothing really more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how comfortable it is and useful when at my desk. And the holder for headphone was useful when I was done at the desk. Nearly fell asleep. Lmao.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for, a perfect addition to my cubicle. It’s easy to adjust and the fabric is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Mustico

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and I love that I can easily adjust either the clamps or the hammock itself to get the height just right, and keep myself comfortable all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

product_meta.title: Foot Hammock Under Desk with Headphones Holder | Upgraded Adjustable Ergonomic Office feet Rest |New Screw in Rubber Clamps | Suitable for All desks | Black
feature_bullets: ★ UPGRADED & REFORMED 2.0 DESIGN | FIXED MOUNTS WITH RUBBER STOPPERS: The new Fixed rubber footed clamps can be adjusted to your most comfortable position and fixed there so you can work at your desk without worrying about your foot hammock sliding or falling down.
★ BONUS | INBUILT HEADPHONES HOLDER : The foot hammock 2.0 has another trick up its sleeve. It can also act as a headphones holder/ handbag/backpack holder for an even versatile experience

★ WORLD-CLASS QUALITY & DURABILITY + CAREFULLY CRAFED BREATHABLE FABRIC: Made by 100% premium quality cotton fabricis soft, non-abrasive and makes it comfortable for you to stay put longer with your leg up without worrying about sweating or any other discomfort

★ PORTABLE, LIGHTWEIGHT & ADJUSTABLE: Easy to fold away and your DESKOOLfeet hammock is adjustable two ways. Low down just for a slight lift during work hours or high up parallel to your thighs when you really want your legs up during lunch. You will love it better than the make shift chair

★ SUITABLE FOR ALL DESK TYPES (100% USER FRIENDLY): The Foot hammock 2.0 is suitable for most desk types with or without a side apron. (See image for clarity) . Table top Thickness : <2.5 inches Table length: <1.4 m
